structure.unit: Nominations, Questions To Be Submitted To The Voters, Primaries And Caucuses

law.text: No convention to nominate candidates shall be called for or held on a date earlier than four days after the holding of the caucuses for the choice of delegates thereto, and all such conventions shall be called for and held on a date not later than forty-eight hours prior to the hour for filing certificates of nomination as provided in section ten.
